issue.title: [R] Add bindings for ifelse() and if_else()
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-12964](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12964). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
ARROW-10640 adds an `if_else` kernel to the C++ library. Add R bindings so users can call `ifelse()` or `if_else()` (the stricter dplyr variant) in dplyr verbs. I believe the C++ kernel requires the second and third arguments to have the same types, just like `dplyr::if_else()`.
